title: Frederick Douglass National Historic Site: Management
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Management             Management          The Frederick Douglass National Historic Site is a unit of the National Park Service. It is managed by National Capital Parks-East. The site preserves and interprets Cedar Hill, where Frederick Douglass lived from 1877 until his death in 1895.  Laws and policies that govern the site include federal and National Park Service laws and regulations, and other policies in the Superintendent's Compendium. Questions? Contact us.      Records  Long Range Interpretive Plan (PDF, 1.6 MB) Historic Structures Report, Part II (PDF, 8.2 MB) Historic Grounds Report (PDF, 978 KB) Cultural Landscape Inventory (PDF, 4.1 MB)      Documents Open for Public Review  Loading ...  There are currently no projects with documents open for public review for Frederick Douglass National Historic Site.    Other Plans and Projects An archive of completed projects as well as projects without documents open for comment may be found on the PEPC website.
